hl.seg: Abstention from dieting in order to avoid Flu.

doc.seg: This research from the American Scientists has come up after the experiments on rats.
It has been proven by experiments that rats put on diets with fewer calories were more prone to the Flu virus.
Research has proven the old myth of fasting during fever wrong.
According to scientists, one should eat a lot during fever.

The researchers from Michigan State University say that the rats that were dieting were not as able to resist the infection, and their chances of dying had increased. Whereas rats on normal diets had better resistance against the Flu virus.
According to Professor Elizabeth Gardner, people who diet will not be affected with flu sooner but they will need more time to recover from it.
She also said that those people who receive the flu vaccine should also avoid dieting during the winter months.

hl.seg: 'First nuclear experiment was done in 1990'

doc.seg: Thomas Reid, who has worked in the Lever National Laboratory in America as a weapon designer, has written this book with the help of the former director of technical intelligence at Los Alamos national laboratory, Dani Stillman.

This book was titled "Nuclear Express: Political History of the Bomb and Its Proliferation," and both writers have claimed that whichever country first made a nuclear bomb either stole the nuclear secrets of another country or had the support of another nuclear power.
In an interview with U.S. news agencies, Thomas Reid said that in 1990 during Benazir Bhutto's rule, China experimented with Pakistan's first nuclear bomb.
Thomas Reid said that for many reasons, he believes that China had experimented with Pakistan's first nuclear bomb.
The reasons include the design of the bomb and some information retrieved during talks with the Chinese scientists.
He further added that this was the reason that in 1998 in a span of only two weeks and three days, Pakistan was able to carry out nuclear experiments in response to Indian nuclear experiments.
Thomas Reid reminds us that in 1961 Russia suddenly carried out a nuclear experiment and besides possessing the bomb for a long time, it took 17 days for America to carry out nuclear experiments.
He further said that atomic bomb test Pakistan conducted on May 28, 1998 was made with extreme care, and Pakistani scientists had complete confidence in it.
When Thomas Reeds was questioned about China providing nuclear technology to Pakistan he replied that India was a common enemy for Pakistan and China.
He said that there is a proof that Doctor Abdul Qadeer Khan used Chinese designs, and the documents which were acquired from Libya confirm this statement.
He further stated that doing combined nuclear tests is common, and that in 1990 the United States conducted a nuclear test for Britain on an open belt in the Nevada desert.
He said that he also assumed that Israel was given access to the results of this test.
Thomas Reed was also questioned whether the Chinese nuclear spread program is continuing?
On this, Thomas Reed said that China has been supplying raw material, instructions and design to a nuclear facility in Iran's city Isfahan since 1990.
Additionally, China provided Iran a nuclear enrichment plant.
He said that China has been providing nuclear technology to Iran, Syria, Pakistan, Egypt, Libya and Yemen thorough North Korea.

This virus creates its own file name.

This virus creates a problem after it gets active; it comes out as 'HTTP Server' and changes the restore point of the machine.
After that, it downloads files from the hacker's website.
Microsoft has reported that this virus has affected computers in different countries.
These countries include China, Brazil, Russia, India, America and Britain.

Experts say that regular tea consumption, at least three cups a day, can drastically reduce the occurrence of breast cancer in young women.

hl.seg: Why Reduce Exercise With Age?
New Research

doc.seg: Exercise at any age is good for your health.
It energizes your heart, reduces cholesterol levels, helps in keeping weight low, helps to prevent diabetes and slows down the process of Alzheimer's or dementia.
Unfortunately the ability to exercise decreases for many people as they age.
Experts say that exercise keeps our body and brain active however age can affect it.
According to the American Medical Association, several health related problems can arise from not doing exercise.
Dr. Patricia Palecca, of Mayo Clinic Minnesota, says that an increase in age is a major cause of inability to exercise and lack of bodily activity.
Dr. Patricia teaches medicine at Mayo Clinic.
She lead a study of how heart related diseases and the ability to exercise is related to old age.
The team of doctors used high frequency sound waves to measure the working of the heart.
The pumping of the blood by the heart - its contraction and relaxation - was studied.
The experts focused on the left part of the heart which is the main part for pumping blood.
They learned that as people grew older there was an increase in faults in the relaxation of the heart.
Dr. Patricia says that as age increases the faults in the relaxation of the heart begin to appear and this affects the ability to exercise.
Dr. Garwin Cain was also a part of this study.

He says that they were surprised to see that there is a definite effect of this and that this clearly proves how deep of a relationship there is between the decrease of exercise and the relaxation of the heart.
Some times blood pressure can cause disorders in the heart such as its functions and heart diseases.
If the doctor and the patient work in tandem in this regard, then they can take advantage of the benefits of exercise even with age.
A detailed report in this matter is published in a magazine of the American Medical Association.
